space.arim.api.concurrent

Interface AsyncExecution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.EnhancedExecutor, Executor, space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.Scheduler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultAsyncExecution

    public interface AsyncExecution
extends space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.EnhancedExecutor, space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.Scheduler
    A service designed for multithreading via asynchronous concurrent execution and scheduling.

    Specifications:
    * from Registrable: requires Registrable.getPriority()
    * from EnhancedExecutor: requires Executor.execute(Runnable)
    * from Scheduler: requires Scheduler.runTaskLater(Runnable, long) and Scheduler.runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long, long)

    Contract:
    * from Registrable: Implementations should be registered under AsyncExecution.
    * from Scheduler: Task.cancel() method implementations should properly cancel further scheduling. Also, time units are in milliseconds.
    * AsyncExecution: All execution and scheduled tasks MUST NOT run on the main thread if the application has a main thread.

    AsyncExecution differs from ExecutorService in a few important ways. First, it is a Registrable. Second, AsyncExecution is not necessarily a thread pool, but simply an executor and scheduler. Thus it does not specify any methods relating to shutting down, awaiting termination, or invoking other callers' submissions. Thirdly, AsyncExecution enables scheduling, which simple thread pools do not.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable

      • Methods inherited from interface space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.EnhancedExecutor

      • Methods inherited from interface space.arim.universal.util.concurrent.Scheduler
